00030 /* Choose wisely my son (do this dynamically in the reader)*/
00031 #define NITF_PARSEINFO_NUMHASHBUCKETS 10
00032 
00033 /****************************
00034 *** NOTE ABOUT THE MACROS ***
00035 *****************************
00036 All of these macros make the assumption that an instance of a NITF_BOOL
00037 named success is in scope and can be overwritten.  Additionally, a label
00038 called CATCH_ERROR must also exist.  These exist to allow the macors to
00039 simulate throwing as seen in C++.  They do nothing more than reduce the
00040 amount of code needed to perform rigorous error checking.
00041 */
00042 #define NITF_PARSEINFO_SET(parseInfo_, key_, data_, error_)     \
00043     success = nitf_ParseInfo_set(parseInfo_,                        \
00044                                  key_,                              \
00045                                  data_,                             \
00046                                  error_);                           \
00047     if( !success)  goto CATCH_ERROR;
00048
